Steve Hardon, [[Chief research officer|CRO]] | industry = [[Computer software]] | products = [[Antivirus software]] | services = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | owner = | num_employees = 663 worldwide | divisions = | subsid = | slogan = ''Tough on threats. Easy on you.'' | homepage = [http://www.avg.com/ www.avg.com] | footnotes = | intl = }} '''AVG Technologies''' (formerly named '''Grisoft''') is a [[privately held company|privately held]] [[Czech Republic|Czech]] [[Company (law)|company]] formed in 1991 by Jan Gritzbach and Tomas Hofer, with corporate offices in [[Europe]] and the [[United States]]. The company specializes in computer security [[Computer software|software]]. ==Products== {{main|AVG (software)}} ===Home security=== * AVG Anti-Virus â [[Antivirus software|Antivirus program]] * AVG Anti-Virus Free Edition * AVG Anti-Virus Free Edition for Linux * AVG Internet Security â Antivirus and [[personal firewall]] * AVG LinkScanner Free Edition â for PC (An online safety tool) * AVG LinkScanner Free Edition - for Apple Mac * AVG PC Tuneup 2011 * AVG Premium Security{{cite web|url=http://www.avg.com/us-en/press-releases-news.ndi-1633 |title=July 28, 2011, AVG Launches Premium Security |publisher=Avg.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-10}} ===Business security=== * AVG Anti-Virus Business Edition â An antivirus program with central administration capabilities * AVG Internet Security Business Edition â A business security suite with central administration capabilities * AVG File Server Edition * AVG E-mail Server Edition * AVG Linux Server Edition ===Mobile security=== * DroidSecurity Antivirus Free for Android Devices * DroidSecurity Antivirus Pro for Android Devices ==History== In 2001, Jan Gritzbach decided to sell Grisoft to Benson Oak Capital Acquisitions. Four years later, Benson Oak sold a 65% share in the company to Intel Capital and Enterprise Investors for $52 million.{{cite web|url=http://www.avg.com/40965 |title=GRISOFT "Celebrates 15 Years of Internet Security Success", AVG Technologies bulletin, 15 December 2006 |publisher=Avg.com |date=2006-12-05 |accessdate=2011-11-10}}{{cite web|url=http://www.grisoft.com/doc/314/lng/us/tpl/tpl01 |title=Intel buys part of Grisoft |publisher=Grisoft.com |date=2005-09-06 |accessdate=2011-11-10}}{{cite web|url=http://www.avg.com/314 |title=Intel buys part of AVG Technologies |publisher=Avg.com |date=2005-09-06 |accessdate=2011-11-10}} On April 19, 2006, Grisoft acquired the German company [[ewido Networks]], an anti-spyware software manufacturer, and incorporated ewido's features into new versions of AVG software.{{cite web|url=http://www.avg.co.uk/30868 |title=AVG Technologies announces release of ewido Anti-Spyware |publisher=Avg.co.uk |date=2006-06-19 |accessdate=2011-11-10}}{{cite web|url=http://www.avguk.com/doc/30868/lng/uk/tpl/tpl01 |title=Grisoft announces release of ewido Anti-Spyware |publisher=Avguk.com |date=2006-06-19 |accessdate=2011-11-10}} On November 6, 2006, [[Microsoft]] announced that AVG Security products would be available directly from the Windows Security Center in Windows Vista.{{cite web|url=http://www.avguk.com/doc/39275/lng/uk/tpl/tpl01 |title=Microsoft incorporates AVG into the Vista Security Center |publisher=Avguk.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-10}} Since June 7, 2006, the AVG software has also been used as an optional component of GFI MailSecurity, produced by [[GFI Software]].{{cite web|url=http://kbase.gfi.com/showarticle.asp?id=KBID002652 |title=What's new in GFI MailSecurity for Exchange/SMTP 10? |publisher=Kbase.gfi.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-10}} On December 5, 2007, Grisoft announced the acquisition of Exploit Prevention Labs, developer of the LinkScanner safe surfing technology. [http://www.grisoft.com/doc/80935/ww/crp/0 AVG Acquires Exploit Prevention Labs, Developer of LinkScanner Safe Surfing Technology]. In February 2008, Grisoft was officially renamed AVG Technologies. This change was made to increase the effectiveness of their marketing activities.[http://www.grisoft.com/doc/89672/us/crp/0 AVG Anti-Virus and Internet Security - Leading Internet security vendor, Grisoft, changes name to AVG Technologies]{{dead link|date=November 2011}} In January 2009, AVG announced their plans to acquire Sana Security are finalized. Plans to integrate Sana's technologies in their free consumer product, [[AVG (software)|AVG Anti-Virus]], are still under consideration, according to JR Smith, AVG's chief executive. Sana Security's developed technologies are currently licensed to Symantec.{{cite web|last=Rubenking |first=Neil J. |url=http://www.pcmag.com/article2/0,2817,2338797,00.asp |title=AVG Buys Sana's Behavior-Based Security Tech | News & Opinion |publisher=PCMag.com |date=2009-01-13 |accessdate=2011-11-10}}{{cite web|last=Meyer |first=David |url=http://news.zdnet.co.uk/security/0,1000000189,39591100,00.htm |title=AVG Technologies buys Sana Security | Security Management | ZDNet UK |publisher=News.zdnet.co.uk |date=2009-01-13 |accessdate=2011-11-10}}{{cite web|last=Hoffman |first=Stefanie |url=http://www.crn.com/security/212900313 |title=AVG Acquires Sana Security, Adds ID Protection |publisher=Crn.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-10}} On October 5, 2009, [[TA Associates]] announced that they bought a minority stake in AVG Technologies for more than $200 million.{{cite web|url=http://www.ta.com/news/news_detail.asp?id=185 |title=TA Associates - News |publisher=Ta.com |date=2009-10-05 |accessdate=2011-11-10}} On June 9, 2010, AVG announced the acquisition of North Carolina-based Walling Data, a North America security software distribution that has distributed AVG offerings across the United States since 2001{{cite web|url=http://www.avg.com/us-en/press-releases-news.ndi-230728 |title=Technologies Acquires Leading US Distributor, Walling Data |publisher=AVG |date=2010-06-10 |accessdate=2011-11-10}} On November 10, 2010, AVG announced the acquisition of [[Tel Aviv]]-based DroidSecurity, a company that specializes int the field of mobile security solutions, for [[Android (operating system)|Android]] devices. Upon completion of the acquisition DroidSecurity will become a wholly owned subsidiary of AVG and DroidSecurity CEO and co-founder, Eran Pfeffer, will become the general manager of AVGâs Mobile Solutions Team.{{cite web|url=http://www.avg.com/eu-en/avg-acquires-droidsecurity |title=AVG Antivirus & Security Software - AVG Technologies to Acquire DroidSecurity |publisher=Avg.com |date=2010-11-10 |accessdate=2011-11-10}} In December of 2010, AVG released a mandatory-install update to the 2011 version of its antivirus software which caused thousands of 64 bit Windows Vista and Windows 7 computers to become completely inoperable. AVG has since released a fix which attempts to repair computers bricked after installing the update. Affected users can watch the following video on AVG's Official YouTube page to resolve the issue http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fam3-KSfA3A ===Partnerships=== On July 1, 2010 AVG partnered with [[Opera Software]] to provide malware security in their web browser [[Opera (web browser)|Opera]], the protection was added to the existing Fraud Protection technology ([[Netcraft]] and [[PhishTank]] from [[Haute Secure]]).{{cite web|url=http://www.dailytech.com/Opera+106+The+Worlds+Fastest+Stable+Browser+Tested+vs+IE+9/article18909.htm |title=Opera 10.6, The World's Fastest Stable Browser, Tested vs. IE 9 |publisher=DailyTech |date= |accessdate=2011-11-10}} On August 20, 2010 AVG entered into partnership with [[MokaFive]] to secure desktop virtualisation solutions. The partnership adds a critical security layer to the virtual desktop marketplace, as more enterprise companies are turning to desktop virtualization as a secure solution for bringing your own computer ([[BYOC]]) and work from home initiatives for employees. {{cite web|url=http://rfpconnect.com/news/2010/8/20/avg-and-mokafive-join-forces-to-secure-virtual-desktops |title=AVG and MokaFive Join Forces to Secure Virtual Desktops | Aug 20, 2010 |publisher=RFPConnect |date=2011-10-08 |accessdate=2011-11-10}} ==See also== *[[AVG (software)]] == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{Official website|http://www.avg.com}} **[http://free.avg.com Official website of free AVG products] **[http://blogs.avg.com AVG Blog] *[http://www.droidsecurity.com DroidSecurity] {{DEFAULTSORT:Avg Technologies}} [[Category:Software companies of the Czech Republic]] [[Category:Companies established in 1991]] [[Category:Privately held companies]] [[Category:Computer security software companies]] [[cs:AVG Technologies]] [[es:AVG Technologies]] [[he:AVG]] [[ro:AVG Technologies]] [[nl:AVG Technologies]] [[ja:AVG Technologies]] [[pl:Grisoft]] [[pt:AVG Technologies]] [[sv:AVG Technologies]]
